comments:
During normal development work I went to a .properties file to update a value. After selecting and deleting text I started to type. The text was being written backwards. The cursor stays in a static position and every new letter is added to the right of the cursor moving the rest of the line along. So entering "true" appears as "eurt".

Opening the error log view I notice that every letter typed causes a java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException and an Unhandled event loop exception.

eclipse.buildId=M20060118-1600

The NegativeArraySizeException stack trace is:
Error 2006-07-04 11:52:55.633 java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException

When trying to delete the text I get an Error Executing Command dialogue and the same stack trace as above but with the following session data:

eclipse.buildId=M20060118-1600
java.version=1.5.0_06
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_GB
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

When I closed and re-opened the properties file the problem went away and I have been unable to re-produce the problem again.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 99490 ***
